definition: demonic/iniquitous/nefarious/evil/unhealthy influences that cause disease (Chinese medicine)/(coll.) strange/abnormal

sentences.english: Notice what the man said, or what the evil spirit in him said (v. 24).
sentences.chinese: 留意那人或附在他体内的邪灵说些甚么。

sentences.english: I see the ravens fly, born of time, demon eye.
sentences.chinese: 我看见鸦群，因时而生，有着邪灵般的眼神。

sentences.english: The ancient Celts believed that wearing masks would ward offevil spirits.
sentences.chinese: 古凯尔特人相信戴上面具可以避开邪灵。

sentences.english: The ancient Celts believed that wearing masks would ward off evil sprits.
sentences.chinese: 古凯尔特人相信戴上面具可以避开邪灵。

sentences.english: Two glasses of water, believed to absorb evil spirits, were placed in front of him.
sentences.chinese: 他面前还放着两杯水，就说是用来吸走邪灵的灵魂的。

sentences.english: People thought the spluttering sound could help drive away evil spirits.
sentences.chinese: 人们认为爆竹声可以帮助驱赶邪灵。

sentences.english: Jesus has more power than any devil, even today.
sentences.chinese: 即使在今天，耶稣比任何邪灵更有能力。

sentences.english: And what kind of spell is mankind under?
sentences.chinese: 人类究竟被施了怎样的咒语，被什么邪灵附身？
